exercises.name: Arm Circles
exercises.description: Make large circles with both arms
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart
Extend arms out to sides at shoulder height
Make slow, controlled circles forward
Gradually increase circle size
Reverse direction after 8-10 circles

exercises.name: Calf Raises
instructions: Stand tall with feet hip-width apart
Rise up onto balls of feet by lifting heels
Hold briefly at top position
Lower heels slowly with control
Use wall or chair for balance if needed

exercises.name: Gentle Marching in Place
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart
Lift one knee up toward chest, then lower
Alternate legs in gentle marching motion
Keep core engaged and posture upright
Move at comfortable, controlled pace

exercises.name: Standing Side Bends
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, hands on hips
Slowly bend to one side, keeping hips facing forward
Return to center, then bend to opposite side
Keep movement controlled and avoid bouncing
Feel gentle stretch along side of torso

exercises.name: Standing Hip Circles
exercises.description: Gentle hip mobility movement, good for warm-up and joint health
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, hands on hips
Make slow circles with hips in one direction
Keep upper body stable and core engaged
Complete 5-8 circles, then reverse direction
Focus on smooth, controlled movement

exercises.name: Standing Heel-to-Butt
instructions: Stand tall with feet hip-width apart
Bend one knee, bringing heel toward buttocks
Hold briefly, then lower foot to ground
Alternate legs in controlled motion
Use wall or chair for balance if needed

exercises.name: Standing Knee Lifts
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart
Lift one knee up toward chest to hip level
Lower with control, then lift opposite knee
Keep core engaged and maintain good posture
Pump arms in opposition for added coordination

exercises.name: Standing Leg Swings
instructions: Stand next to wall or chair for support
Swing one leg forward and backward
Keep leg straight and movement controlled
Perform front-to-back, then side-to-side
Complete 8-12 swings per direction per leg

exercises.name: Standing Torso Twists
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart
Cross arms over chest or place hands on shoulders
Rotate upper body left and right
Keep hips facing forward throughout movement
Perform 10-15 controlled twists per side

exercises.name: Standing Figure-4 Stretch
instructions: Stand near wall or chair for support
Place ankle of one leg on opposite knee
Gently sit back to deepen hip stretch
Keep standing leg slightly bent
Hold 15-30 seconds per side

exercises.name: Single Leg Balance
instructions: Stand on one leg with other leg lifted
Keep lifted leg bent at knee or extended
Maintain balance without support
Engage core and focus on stable standing leg
Build up to 30-60 seconds per leg

exercises.name: Dynamic Standing Movements
instructions: Combine multiple standing exercises in sequence
Flow between arm circles, leg swings, and twists
Maintain good form throughout transitions
Incorporate multi-planar movements
Perform 60-90 second flowing sequences

exercises.name: Standing Balance with Eyes Closed
instructions: Start in single leg balance position
Close eyes while maintaining balance
Focus on proprioception and core stability
Keep near wall or support for safety
Build up to 20-45 seconds per leg
